comments:
Declarative Force Setup

Unified system for declaratively configuring force simulations.
Replaces the older ForceSpec (too simple) and Config.* modules (wrong abstraction layer).

Key features:
- Static or dynamic (per-node) parameter values
- Optional filters to apply forces selectively
- Idempotent `applySetup` that works for both initial setup and updates

Example:
```purescript
mySetup = setup "physics"
  [ manyBody "charge" # withStrength (-30.0)
  , collide "collision" # withRadius (dynamic _.r)
  , positionX "gridX" # withX (dynamic _.gridX) # withStrength 0.1
  , positionY "gridY" # withY (dynamic _.gridY) # withStrength 0.1
  ]

-- Apply to simulation (idempotent - can call repeatedly)
applySetup mySetup sim

-- Update: just call applySetup with new config
applySetup (mySetup # removeForce "charge") sim
```

declarations.comments: A value that can be static or computed per-node
declarations.title: Value

declarations.comments: Create a static value
declarations.title: static

declarations.comments: Create a dynamic (per-node) value
declarations.title: dynamic

declarations.comments:
Extract a number from a Value (for static values only, dynamic returns default)
Used internally; prefer the accessor pattern for dynamic values
declarations.title: valueToNumber

declarations.comments: Force type enumeration
declarations.title: ForceType

declarations.comments:
Configuration for a single force
Parameterized by node type for dynamic values and filters
declarations.title: ForceConfig

declarations.comments: Get the name of a force config
declarations.title: forceName

declarations.comments:
Create a many-body (charge) force
Default: repulsive with strength -30
declarations.title: manyBody

declarations.comments:
Create a collision force
Default: radius 1, strength 1
declarations.title: collide

declarations.comments:
Create a link (spring) force
Default: distance 30, strength 1
declarations.title: link

declarations.comments:
Create a centering force
Default: center at (0, 0), strength 1
declarations.title: center

declarations.comments:
Create an X-positioning force
Default: x = 0, strength 0.1
declarations.title: positionX

declarations.comments:
Create a Y-positioning force
Default: y = 0, strength 0.1
declarations.title: positionY

declarations.comments:
Create a radial force
Default: radius 100, center (0,0), strength 0.1
declarations.title: radial

declarations.comments: Set strength (works for all force types)
declarations.title: withStrength

declarations.comments: Set radius (for Collide, Radial)
declarations.title: withRadius

declarations.comments: Set X position/target (for Center, PositionX, Radial)
declarations.title: withX

declarations.comments: Set Y position/target (for Center, PositionY, Radial)
declarations.title: withY

declarations.comments: Set distance (for Link)
declarations.title: withDistance

declarations.comments: Set theta (Barnes-Hut approximation, for ManyBody)
declarations.title: withTheta

declarations.comments: Set iterations (for Collide, Link)
declarations.title: withIterations

declarations.comments: Add a filter predicate (force only applies to matching nodes)
declarations.title: withFilter

declarations.comments: Set distance min (for ManyBody)
declarations.title: withDistanceMin

declarations.comments: Set distance max (for ManyBody)
declarations.title: withDistanceMax

declarations.comments: Complete setup: forces + simulation params
declarations.title: Setup

declarations.comments: Simulation parameters
declarations.title: SetupParams

declarations.comments: Default simulation parameters
declarations.title: defaultParams

declarations.comments: Create a setup with default params
declarations.title: setup

declarations.comments: Create a setup with custom params
declarations.title: setupWithParams

declarations.comments: Get forces from setup
declarations.title: getForces

declarations.comments: Get params from setup
declarations.title: getParams

declarations.comments: Add a force to the setup
declarations.title: addForce

declarations.comments: Remove a force by name
declarations.title: removeForce

declarations.comments: Update a force by name (replace if exists)
declarations.title: updateForce

declarations.comments: Set alpha
declarations.title: withAlpha

declarations.comments: Set alpha decay
declarations.title: withAlphaDecay

declarations.comments: Set alpha target
declarations.title: withAlphaTarget

declarations.comments: Set alpha min
declarations.title: withAlphaMin

declarations.comments: Set velocity decay
declarations.title: withVelocityDecay

declarations.comments:
Apply a setup to a simulation.

This is idempotent - calling with the same setup does minimal work:
- Forces in setup but not simulation: create and add
- Forces in simulation but not setup: remove

After applying, forces are re-initialized with current nodes.

Example:
```purescript
-- Initial setup
applySetup mySetup sim

-- Later: update setup (just call again)
applySetup (mySetup # removeForce "charge") sim
```
declarations.title: applySetup

declarations.comments:
Result of a node data update with enter/update/exit categorization

- entered: Nodes newly added to simulation (use for enter animations)
- updated: Existing nodes that were modified (simulation state preserved)
- exited: Nodes removed from simulation (use for exit animations)
declarations.title: GUPResult

declarations.comments:
Result of a link data update with enter/update/exit categorization
Links are keyed by (source, target) pair
declarations.title: GUPLinkResult

declarations.comments:
Apply setup with new nodes and links, using GUP (General Update Pattern) semantics.

This function handles three concerns:
1. Force configuration (same as applySetup)
2. Node GUP: diff desired nodes vs current, merge simulation state for updates
3. Link GUP: diff desired links vs current

Simulation state preservation (for updated nodes):
- x, y: Current position (preserved)
- vx, vy: Current velocity (preserved)
- fx, fy: Pinned position (preserved)
- All other fields: Taken from desired nodes

Example usage:
```purescript
-- Stop simulation before transition
Sim.stop sim

-- Apply new configuration and data
result <- applySetupWithData mySetup newNodes newLinks sim

-- Use result for animations
animateEnter result.nodes.entered
animateExit result.nodes.exited

-- Restart simulation
Sim.reheat sim
```
declarations.title: applySetupWithData

declarations.comments: Internal result type that includes the merged array
declarations.title: NodeGUPInternal

declarations.comments:
Compute node GUP: which nodes are entering, updating, exiting
For updates, merge simulation state (x, y, vx, vy, fx, fy) from current into desired
declarations.title: computeNodeGUP

declarations.comments:
Compute link GUP: which links are entering, updating, exiting
Links are keyed by (source, target) pair
declarations.title: computeLinkGUP

declarations.comments:
Merge simulation-managed state from current node into desired node

Preserves: x, y, vx, vy, fx, fy (simulation-managed)
Takes from desired: everything else (application data)
declarations.title: mergeSimulationState

declarations.comments: Add a single force to simulation (without full setup)
declarations.title: addForceToSim

declarations.comments: Remove a single force from simulation by name
declarations.title: removeForceFromSim

name: PSD3.ForceEngine.Setup
